content.title: Dr. D.S. Kothari Post Doctoral Fellowships In Sciences
content.beneficiary: Young researchers with a Ph.D. degree in sciences
content.details: Dr. D.S. Kothari Post Doctoral Fellowships in Sciences was introduced by the University Grants Commission, Dept. of Higher Education. The initiative would offer ₹ 10,00,000 in financial assistance to 132 selected candidates. The tenure is 2 years, and the scheme is open for full-time research work, predominantly to young researchers preferably below 35 years of age who have been awarded their Ph.D. Degree under science faculty.
benefits: Fellowship amount of ₹ 43,800/- pm for the 1st year
Fellowship amount of ₹ 45,000/- pm for the 2nd year
Fellowship amount of ₹ 46,500/- pm for the 3rd year
House Rent Allowance (HRA) based on accommodation type
Medical facilities available in the University/Institution/College
Leave for a maximum period of 30 days in a year
eligibility: The candidate must have a doctorate degree in the relevant subject preferably with published research work to their credit.
Only Ph.D. awarded unemployed candidates will be eligible for the award of Post Doctoral Fellowship.
The upper age limit for applicants is 35 years, with relaxation in age for SC/ST/OBC/Women candidates applicable as per Government of India Norms.
content.application_process: Online application process through the designated website (http://ugcdskpdf.unipune.ac.in/). The selection process is open all year round and not restricted by any specified deadlines.
documents_required: Joining Report in the prescribed format
Contingency utilization certificate after one year

faqs.question: Is There A Deadline For The Submission Of The Applications?
faqs.answer: No, the selection process is open all year round and not restricted by any specified deadlines.

faqs.question: Why Was The 'D. S. Kothari Post Doctoral Fellowships In Sciences' Introduced?
faqs.answer: It was introduced to provide a flexible PDF scheme with fast track, online handling, and decision-making.

faqs.question: Can I Apply Offline For The Fellowship?
faqs.answer: No, the entire process is being carried out online.

faqs.question: What Is The Tenure Of The Fellowship?
faqs.answer: The tenure of the fellowship is 2 years.

faqs.question: Is There A Reservation For SC/ST Candidates?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Reservation Policy of the Government of India is followed.

faqs.question: Is It Compulsory For The Applicant To Have A Doctorate Degree?
faqs.answer: Yes, the candidate must have a doctorate degree in the relevant subject.
